name: Hardest Along Came Jones Trivia Quiz | Name Game | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which Welsh singer was a hit with 'Delilah'?
questions.explanation:
Tom Jones.

	Tom Jones is known for wearing tight pants.

questions.text: This American animation director created 'Road Runner', 'Pepe Le Pew' and 'Wile E. Coyote'?
questions.explanation:
Chuck Jones.

	Chuck was an animation director for Warner Brothers.

questions.text: This English sportsman turned actor appeared in the movie 'Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels'?
questions.explanation:
Vinnie Jones.

	Vinny played football(soccer) for Wimbledon, Leeds, Chelsea and Wales.

questions.text: What Bond movie did Jamaican singer and actress Grace Jones appear in?
questions.explanation:
'A View to a Kill'.

	Grace was born in 1952 in Spanishtown, Jamaica.

questions.text: Tammy Wynette 'stood by this man', after all she was married to him. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
George Jones.

	George won the best male vocalist at the Country Music Awards in 1980 and 1981.

questions.text: John Paul Jones, the 'Father' of the U.S. Navy, was born in Scotland. Where did he die?
questions.explanation:
Paris, France.

	His famous quote during the Revolutionary War was, 'I have not yet began to fight'.

questions.text: Reverend Jim Jones led the mass suicide of nearly 1000 followers of his 'People's Temple'. Where did this take place?
questions.explanation:
Jonestown , Guyana.

	The mass suicide took place on November 18th 1978.

questions.text: What name do the singer from the 'Monkees' and the alter ego of 'Ziggy Stardust' have in common?
questions.explanation:
David Jones.

	David Jones preferred to use the name Davy. David Bowie's real name is David Robert Hayward-Jones.

questions.text: Shirley Jones played the mother on what popular tv series of the 1970s?
questions.explanation:
'The Partridge Family'.

	Shirley Jones is David Cassidy's step-mom. She won an Oscar for her role in 'Elmer Gantry'.

questions.text: What is Quincy Jones' middle name?
questions.explanation:
Delight.

	Quincy Jones wrote the scores for over fifty films.
